thread.title: Earth will be transformed by birth of a SUPERCONTINENT as landmasses collide, says expert
thread.title_full: Earth will be transformed by birth of a SUPERCONTINENT as landmasses collide, says expert

title: Earth will be transformed by birth of a SUPERCONTINENT as landmasses collide, says expert
text:
The fault lines which separate the plates are deadly, with devastating earthquakes Australia will be in collision with southeast Asia Christopher Scotese 
In the modern age, the movement of the continents is mapped using satellite tracking. 
Susan Hough, a seismologist at the US Geological Survey in California, explained: â€œIt's like a big soup cauldron. 
"The plates are like little bits of crust on top of the soup." 
WHAT IS THE RING OF FIRE? 
But the fault lines which separate the plates are deadly, with devastating earthquakes, volcanoes and tsunamis rife along its borders. 
Millions of people have perished in these natural disasters, which sometimes occur without warning and can destroy entire communities. GETTY Prehistoric landmass pangea made up of all the continents 
Key locations around the world are hotspots, including the notorious Ring of Fire. 
Rife with earthquakes and volcanic eruptions, the danger zone stretches from the outside of Australia around the eastern coast of Japan and coming down the western coast of the North and South American continents. Related articles
